content.detailedDescription: I dont know why im reporting this nothing gets done no ans. are ever given but here goes. last night around 3am i saw a red and green light float up out of trees sit for a sec then take of no sound could make out shape. and then tonight just a couple of min ago a flash of lightning made me look up to see what looked like a very bright star in the sky. the object never moved but i did start to glow brighter for about 12 sec total, and when the light got bright enogh to start making those cross twinkle glare things bright lights do, it just vanished just like that gone. i cant say that it left or moved the light just turned off. theres my report what will get done with it who knows.
content.summary: Looked like star then gone.

content.detailedDescription: I apologize to everyone for taking so long to give in my personal report. i am a mufon field investigator for the miami area and on march 12, 2009 at 10:25 p.M. i had my own personal ufo encounter. i was crossing back accross the street to my townhouse after going to a convenience store for a pack of cigarettes.I live on (*partial address deleted--sgonzalez/cms) and as you go east on it, it then becomes the "96th street broad causeway" which is over water and about a half a mile inland from miami beach/bay harbour area. as i looked in both directions, east and west for on coming traffic i saw a very unusual oblong object luminous and glowing just over the broad causeway in the east. puzzled by what i saw i continued to cross the street but instead of going in my home i continued to walk as fast as i could to get a closer look at this object. i was sure that if i just got a closer look i know i would be able to identify this object. i thought i might be looking at the side of a blimp or possibly an oblong balloon. there were definately odd things about it. it floated slowly, about 20 mph in a steady north by northwest direction heading into a residential area called "keystone point". it was completely silent. there was no writing, drawing or numbers on it. it had a definate luminous outline against the back drop of the dark night sky on it's bottom half and around the front and back ends. it was the upper half that i could not get a clear description of. it appeared unevenly sloped on top and seemed to narrow halfway down towards the tail end. there was a red light on the upper half, on top, mid center. there was another red light on the bottom half again, mid center. it's surface appeared to have silvery white metalic tiles that shimmered in the night sky. they were more apparent on the upper half and side and were shimmering in the night as if the object was reflecting bright lights off of it as though it were sitting in the middle of a football stadium and was covered in bright flood lights. i watched it for five minutes. it appeared about a thousand feet long and 200 feet high at it's highest point and about 1000 feet up. good year + met life denied it was there's. i discussed the object at length with (**name deleted--sgonzalez/cms), representing good year blimp. he stated that their blimp had already landed that night by 9:00 pm and was in the lauderhill area, not near me. he said the two red lights would have been beackon lights and it sounded like it was some sort of an "airship" but what kind he did not have a clue. it was not the other blimp by metlife because i would have seen the large snoopy dog logo on the side had it been there's. i had a clear, unobstrucked view of the object, taking my eyes off of it for only one second to see if anybody else was walking on the street, seeing what i was seeing. i was alone. when i realized that there was no logical explanation for what i was looking at that night i stopped dead in my tracks until it floated out of view.
content.summary: I saw a luminous/oblong object in the night sky over the miami beach area that slowly floated n-nw about a half a mile inland and less than a half a mile away from me.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my dad were standing outside talking and we looked up into the sky and saw this very brite yellow/white lite. at first we thought it was one of those chinese lanterns but this was to brite to be one of those and it moved in several diffirent directions. it was kind of scary. we watched the object for several minutes and then it blanked out!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: It was very very brite! yellow/white.

content.detailedDescription:
Two objects 1 - at about 30 degrees above the horizon due south of our location and the 2 - at about 30 degrees above the horizon south south west of our location.

both were stationary for more than 5 minutes and then both ascended about another 5 degrees on station as to previous location

at all times during observation they appeared to pulse the colors, which caused me to get binoculars to attempt to identify the source.  i then realized that they were apparently stationary until one moved to my right and upward, looking to the other i realizes that it too had moved.

both were very star like save for the pulsing of colors.
content.summary: Flashing green blue yellow.

content.detailedDescription:
It's an old story of mine. happened to me when i was working for summer as student in wisconsin dell, wi area in summer of 2003. event happened in early calendar summer at night (around midnight) on some night of probably late july or maybe early august. night was kind of bright thanks to a bright full moon.

at late night (probably before midnight) i wanted to get some fresh air and decided to have a lonely ride in my car. i took my car from home (we were living between lake delton and wisconsin dells) and traveled at night through broadway (in wisconsin dells), then leaving wisconsin dells downtown area behind and taking right turn on some highway (from google maps i think it was route 16).

i have traveled a couple miles east and then pulled over to small local dirt road (on left) ending in the middle of a corn field. i stopped the car, shut engine off and enjoyed the beautiful view of the bright full moon in front and above me while sitting in car (kind of in the middle of corn field it was). i kept my windows rolled down and enjoyed the warm summer breeze.

i smoked a cigarette and at some point i noticed something odd. the sky got a little brighter than it was before, for some reason i started having a very strong urge to leave this place quickly, started looking around (nobody around, only seen maybe one or two cars passed on highway far behind me) and i noticed it got dead silent in this place.

then i noticed it. it was the moon!!! and actually it couldn't be the moon, because it was located now in a different spot on the dark sky, i also believe it appeared bigger to me than a while ago (couple minutes it takes to smoke a cig). not really knowing why it scared the hell out of me. immediately started the car and backed out of that corn field to highway shoulder and rammed on the gas pedal, i remember looking in the rear view mirror and seeing the "moon" now behind me while it was supposed to be on my right! geeeez ... accelerated like crazy and as fast as i could i started traveling back in wisconsin dells downtown direction. for a few minutes i was having this very very scary feeling that the "moon" was chasing me (maybe it was only trying to scaring me off who knows)... it all lasted maybe 10 minutes. once left the route 16 the feeling went away, everything returned to normal. moon was were it was supposed to be and there was nothing scary anymore.

i will remember that feeling for a very long time.
content.summary: What looked like a full moon above the corn field moved and was chasing me shortly.

content.detailedDescription: The family was having a 4th of july cook out in my mother's back yard. there were 14 adults present and we were watching neighbors shoot off fireworks in the area. my brother said, "what is that?". he was looking at the sky to the southeast. we all saw what he was looking at and it was an orange glowing orb, bigger than a star and almost appeared to be on fire. it was traveling silently from southeast to northwest and seemed to slow and hover when it was midway in the sky. my sister had been taking pictures and quickly aimed her camera towards it and took a short video. we made the obvious guesses to what it was; a weather balloon, venus, a kite, fireworks, but none seemed to fit this behavior.It moved slightly faster than a plane, but it was much bigger and had no blinking lights. as it started moving again towards the northwest the glowing diminished and it seemed to get smaller. then it was gone. there was puzzlement and curiosity while we were watching it and then immediately after a sense of "wow" and "that was creepy/weird". there was some joking and speculation if it was a ufo. no one we have spoken with observed it, but we were pretty awed to see other reports of similar objects across the country on the same date.
content.summary: Orange glowing orb.

content.detailedDescription: I and four other friends were in my backyard particpating in the neighborhood fourth of july celebrations in south st. louis city. at 10:13 someone yelled out, "what's that!" and pointed up at a 45 degree angle across the main street by my house. we could all see what looked like an orange pumpkin or basketball floating from our left to right. quickly another one appeared. they were traveling in a roughly se to nw direction, silent. it appeared that the bottom of the objects where a brighter orange than the rest of it, which appeared to have ridges as a pumpkin or basketball might. there was wind going in an e to w direction on the ground, but fireworks did seem to indicate that above ground the wind was more se to nw. the two objects floated mostly by our location, but went very straight along a 5 degree incline. it was as if they were on a "rail" in the sky as they did not quiver nor alter their speed at all during the time we could see them. when the two had mostly passed by, a third one came along the same route. the first two dimmed and went away while yet keeping the 5 degree incline. the third object got brighter as it went in the distance until i finally stopped looking at it. i got pictures but they were small and jiggly and didn't show anything definitive. they could have been chinese lanterns, though i haven't yet found any sold in our area with the shape these had. it was also quite strange that none of the three orange spheres changed the pace at which they flew by, although the wind was not so constant, nor seemingly as strong as these objects were flying fast. while i understand that it seems most reasonable to figure that the objects were chinese lanterns, it was not normal for three objects to fly in the wind at a constant rate of speed and incline, for the first two lanterns to "burn out" and yet increase in altitude as they burned out - and for the last one to increase its light intensity the further it got away. none of that is natural, so the lights were unidentified as far as some of us were concerned. ironically, last july 4th 3 orange "flames" flew by in the same general path as this year's, although last year the two witnesses agreed that the three lights literally looked like three licks of flames, orange fire without containers.
content.summary: Three orange spheres fly over while shooting fireworks.

content.detailedDescription: It was winter time and a crystal clear night. i had let my dogs outside to use the bathroom and was star  gazing. i witnessed something that flew directly above me that had 3 soft blue or grayish orbs in the shape of a triangle. it was at very, very low altitude, <= 400', cruising about the speed of a small single engine plane. it made no sound whatsoever, and was veering right, at a curve. it was a very very quiet night, and i live in town, at the time there were no cars out and it was pretty much silent and cold. when it passed me overhead, it appeared that the orbs made a circle and twisted around each other one time. then it almost immediately dimmed until i couldn't see it anymore. it was definitely a singular craft of some sort, not 3 individual objects. the whole event lasted 6 seconds at the most. my reaction was one of fear. i had a sense of static or being watched. i ran inside and locked my door in fact.
content.summary: Silent 3 orbed craft in triangle formation flew overhead.

content.detailedDescription: I had worked all night at (*name of business deleted--sgonzalez/cms) in ellensburg, washington and had promised to transport my sister and her boyfriend to the university of oregon in eugene the next morning.  i was able to drive most of the day but got too tired just east of sisters.  we pulled over to camp at a usfs campground and i fell asleep rather early in the evening.  i awoke shortly after 2:00 a.M. and turned the radio on in the car for something to do.  i was gazing into the sky at roughly 3:00 a.M. when a round, bright white object, similar in size and shape to a full moon emerged from behind the hills to the north and crossed a straight flight path through the western night sky in about 8 seconds.  i heard no engine noise but sensed a very slight "whooshing" sound.  it disappeared into the southern horizon.  i only remember a brief impulse to wake my companions but quickly realized that the object was moving with such speed that my moment would have been lost if i turned away.
content.summary: Saw a round, bright white object cross the sky from horizon to horizon.

content.detailedDescription:
Witness contacted our state director -marilyn carlson- by phone on june 8th in the evening about lights dancing erratically to the north of his house. these lights appeared june 6,7,8,and 9th at different times and different durations. marilyn went by his house on june 10th in the evening and watched the sky with night vision and also just eyesight but witnessed no light's, although 6 awac's planes flew over close by. (tinker air force base is not very far away). the witness had taken hd video of the light's on a number of occasion's during the night's in question but with the ambient lights (street light's and neighbor's porch light's), the quality was not very good (this sighting was in the middle of a neighborhood).
i went over to the witnesses house the next night friday the 11th in the evening and watched the sky for approx 1 1/2 hour's to no avail also. marilyn and i both were asked inside to view the video he had made. witness stated he would make a copy for us but after 4 request's to do so, he hasn't produced it yet. i talked to him again this evening and he reports he hasn't seen the light's again although he still checks on it often. the video showed white light's, size could not be determend, dancing left, right, up and down intermintinelly(sp) about 30 degrees above the horizon, pretty much due north. he said to the naked eye, they had color's that kept changing and also out of the cameras view (he had it on a tripod which was a good thing) farther up maybe 50-60 degree's above the horizon there more of the light's dancing around off and on. i find this case interesting for the 4 night's in a row these things showed up but again very inconsistant. the witness also had some neighbor's across the street look at them when they got home on the 6th, and they also saw the object's(?) and were baffled at what they might be.

rick gardner  fi
content.summary: Errattic lights.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4th me, my husband and two friends walked across my field to watch some fireworks off in the distance. after watching for about 15 minutes, we all suddenly noticed 3 distinct balls of light yellowish in appearance. we all debated exactly what they were for a minute when they formed a triangle then they formed a line then they all came together and blinked out. about two minutes later, they appeared again in the exact same spot in the sky this time they repeated the the same thing again except this time a fourth one rose up directly underneath the three and joined them and blinked out. the first appearance lasted almost 5 minutes then a two minute gap and and another 5 minutes for the second appearance.There was not any way these were fireworks or planes they were moving with intelligence they were no blinking lights they were light bright yellow fireballs with a slight blue tinge on three sides of each. they were approximately 400-500 feet up much higher than any of the fireworks which were much closer. they were just south of st. marys at the end of the potomac river almost at the mouth of the chesapeake bay. we absolutely all agreed these were not planes nor were they fireworks. i was hoping to god that someone had taken a video of them it being the 4th of july. we were looking at the fireworks they were much closer in proximity to us these were much higher than the fireworks and were stationary in the sky until they started making formations.The movements were slow and deliberate they formed a triangle and then a line they moved all together into one. both times it was repeated except the second time a fourth one rose up from below all 3 and joined them. it was the a little scary it was not normal. we kept asking eachother if we were all seeing the same thing. we made a pact not to forget what we saw i don't think i will ever forget it.
content.summary: 3 balls of yellow light made different arrangements blinked out two minutes came back exact spot did it again only 4th came up and all came together did it again.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 9:50pm my wife and i were out on a deck associated with this vacation/rented property *(address deleted--sgonzalez/cms), when she saw two red lights appear above the horizon. she called to me to look which i did and saw a single red light before it vanished. i went inside to retrieve my binoculars, but it was too dark to see anything else. 

please note that i am making this second report of the same type sighting i witnessed along with my son on a similar vacation, i think last year. it too was reported to mufon. this sighting was different in that after trying the binoculars, i went an got a night vision device, monocular in design (nvm hereafter)  with a minimal amount of magnification. 

a few minutes later the light appeared again, followed by a second. both were well above the horizon with one at a higher altitude then the other. even though we both had heard the sound from a passing commercial jet about 10 minutes earlier (probably at 36k feet) we could hear nothing from these lights/vehicles. all commentary is based on what i saw by using the nvm from this point forward.

after about 20 seconds, the light on the right descended to a point equal with the other.  the two lights were absolutely silent and stationary until the two suddenly brightened to the point i had to look away. the lights lit the entire area below and around the vehicles but did not illuminate the crafts at all. the nvm was too bright to keep looking through and i looked away briefly. i looked back to see both dim from bright-white to the normal red. my wife was nothing less than amazed at how bright the lights were, as was i to be honest. after dimming, i could still see both while my wife could not see them at all as the lights had dimmed very low. it was only with the nvm that they could be seen after the two had brightened and then dimmed. the two remained stationary for about 20 seconds, then the one on the right migrated left and seemed to fuse with the other. the light remained the same color and intensity after the two "joined", if that is what they did...

after only a few seconds, the now single light began moving at a slow pace and without sound to the southwest. after crossing what i believe to be the western compass point the light split into two with one moving to the north such that it crossed the big dipper just below the "pointers".  after only a few seconds with both being seen in the nvm, the light that had moved towards the north also split into two separate lights. i followed the "new" light as it moved back towards the west. after a moment, the first light that had stayed in the west also came into view. subsequently, the western light split. now, there were four lights. these more pr less just faded away from sight after about 3 minutes. it was about 10:25 pm eastern at this point. i gave up as my arm was too fatigued to continue holding the night vision scope.

this episode is a replay, more or less of the event from last year which i reported. the only differences being attributable to the night vision scope this time, and of course the brightening of the lights of whatever these were. 

it should be noted that several aircraft were noted by the flashing strobes during this period, particularly towards the end. although it seemed as thought no less than two helos in the immediate area visible through the scope at the same time as two of the light made no moves to either get closer, or move away from the lights. there is no way these were any type of known aircraft; not helos, not harriers, most certainly not fixed-winged, nor were they the newer osprey. as stated in my earlier report of last year (maybe it was '08?) i am very versed in most aircraft types having grown up as the son of a marine helo driver. i have no less than 60 scaled models of aircraft on display at my home in raleigh. these vehicles made no sound. stood stationary without any detectable movement in a 20 mph wind, and got close enough together to appear to fuse into each other.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Redish lights appear, brighten, dim, flare-to-bright white, dim, move, split x2.

content.detailedDescription:
i was alone in my back yard, when i seen this object coming from the west flying directly over our houses approx 150 feet in the air. i first thought it might be an odd shaped balloon, because it was smooth and shiny. gray in color. and it wasn't making any noise. as it passed over our house i thought "no it's not a balloon, there is no wind and this thing is going aprox 40 mph."  there was no engine pods. no lights. no windows. no control surfaces. no trailing edge. ( all wings that i know about aren't rounded at the rear edge like this craft was.)
 i've been to oshkosh a few times so i've seen a lot of planes, and i build and fly rc planes.
content.summary: Craft flew over our house. 12-7-95.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing on high street bridge, hamilton,ohio. southside.  waiting for fireworks around 9:30 getting dark.  to my right, west, 2000feet up was a hovering object no sound after watching for about 15 minutes, realized it was not a helicopter.  could see it was a flat shape with green light on right, red light on left, a bright white light in middle.  it would twist staying flat and i could see the left red light then twist back and i could see green light.  i realized it was twisting because of the lights.  i watched for about an hour during and after fireworks.  it slowly started moving back southwest.  went to get my car and followed it lost sight of it.
content.summary: Hovering lights green and red  and white in the middle from my angel it was flat about the size of a small plane.

content.detailedDescription: On july 3, 2010 i first saw the object. at lake burton, in the mountains of clayton, georgia, every year there is a fireworks show on billy goat island. after the finale of the fireworks, my cousin and i noticed a round, oval-like flame flickering in the sky. i thought it was a burning plane and was hit by the fireworks. but, then it started to maneuver around left to right, up then down some, for about 2 minutes. then, it went directly up into the sky slowly and disappeared, almost like the "flame" in it had went out. then, tonight, july 6, 2010, my mother noticed the object out the window. i ran out and identified it as what i saw the other night. this time, there were 3 of them, but all came out at different times. the first one (9:46pm) stayed to the right of the sky and went up. the second one (9:51pm) was in the middle of the sky and went up. finally, the last one was in the far left of the sky, coming out from behind one of the mountains. it was very large and very orange and bright and we could see a "flame". we got binoculars and i looked and it appeared to be shaped like a hot air balloon but more oval and teardrop like which was white. it looked like the flame was surrounded by an orb or halo of translucent white which held the flame. it went straight up and disappeared.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange flamelike.

content.detailedDescription:
Me and my wife spent the fourth of july weekend visiting put-in-bay, ohio.  on saturday, july 3rd, 2010, we were riding our bikes toward the perry's victory monument.  it was approximately 10:30 am, eastern time, and the monument was directly to our east.  the morning sun was extremely bright, and the skies were perfectly clear.  the sun was directly behind the top of the structure when we rode by, so i stopped to take a picture.  it was very peaceful and quiet at this time.  the top of the tower was glowing from the sun behind it.  i took a picture with my digital camera, although it was very hard to see what i was shooting because of the intense sunlight.  when i got home, i transferred the pictures from our trip to my computer in order to print them.  when i printed the picture of the monument, i noticed something in the air behind it, about half-way up on the right side.  i didn't think much of it until i looked very close.  then i looked at it on the computer, and i zoomed in as far as i could.  i saw a very distinct, metallic, steep-angled, saucer-shaped flying object.  it was very startling.  i remember having to squint whenever i looked in the direction of the monument, and my attention was focused on the glowing top, so i did not notice the object when i took the picture, only when i printed it out.  and, like i said above, it was a very quiet and peaceful time of the morning, and me and my wife made a note of how quiet it was at that time (no airplane or helicopter noises).


if you need any other info from me about this event, just let me know.
content.summary: Object noticed on photo of perry's victory monument.

content.detailedDescription:
The event occurred on july 4th at approx. 9:15 pm (central standard time).  i was standing by our parked car awaiting the fireworks display to start in mundelein, illinois.  i looked up into the sky towards the west and noticed a orange-red sphere (ufo) with flashing lights traveling at a high rate of speed (similar to an airplane) with no sound emitting from the object.  i was with my fiancee and her daughter and we were able to directly observe the ufo for approx. 3 minutes (went it completely got out of our range of vision).  

we captured the event on a camera phone.  unfortunately, the quality of the picture is poor since my fiancee's daughter was quite nervous and her hand was shaking most of the time.  in actuality, the ufo was traveling at what appeared to be a constant speed and in a straight line (from west to east).  i apologize in advance to those who will watch the video since i yelled out several expletives while taping the ufo.  this was a unique and amazing experience to all of us.

there were many, many people in the vicinity who also witnessed this ufo.  this was because the place we parked was filled with family / people who were waiting for the fireworks display to start.

http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=1vut7v1ywo8
content.summary: Orange-red sphere with lights flashing traveling at high rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription: While watching fireworks,my wife and i observed two orange/yellow orbs moving about the speed of small plane or hellicopter at a low alltitude,maybe 1000ft. moving south to north,arond the intersection of hwy 141,21 one seem to pause for a second and then resume flight path,flying in a straight line lasted about 45seconds till they were out of veiw
content.summary: Two glowing orbs.

content.detailedDescription: My kids and i went outside in front of the house to watch fireworks some of the meighbors were lighting off the night before the 4th.  my son said look at that floating fire ball, it looks like a firework is still burning.  my daughter and i were looking south and turned to the northwest and sure enough, it looked like a floating ember.  as i studied it, the orange glow was constant, the same color as a flame.  the shape was pear or bell like and was not flickering or flashing, no becon's or strobe lights, and was silent.  it was moving slower than a single engine airplane, but faster than the breeze through the neighborhood.  we watched it for about 2 minutes traveling from the northwest to the southeast until we couldn't see it anymore. i'd guess it may have been about 1000 feet up and maybe a quarter mile away. there was no change in speed, altitude or the color/brightness, and i can definitively say it was not an airplane or burning ember from a firework.
content.summary: Orange glowing bell or pear like shape object traveling from nw to se. constant orange glow, no sound.

content.detailedDescription: On the 3rd of july around 10:15 p.M.-ish, we (7 of us family members) were lighting some tame fireworks in our driveway. lots of other folks in the area were doing the same, as it was 4th of july eve. i said to my 10 yr. old son, "we should've checked to see if the iss was due by." but we didn't want to break away from the fun to come inside and check the computer. after watching the show for a few minutes (maybe 15 or so), on what was a totally clear night with lots of stars and the big dipper overhead, my son said "look, mom, i think it's the iss!" coming toward us from the south heading due north (which isn't a usual flight path for the space station in our area, i thought) was a bright, non-blinking, silent, star-like object, just like the iss, but much lower in the sky. however, when it got almost directly overhead, it flared up extremely brighter for a few seconds, almost like a searchlight, but with no sound whatsoever. it then dimmed back to the brightness it was originally spotted, and it seemed to travel at a faster rate than it's first approach, continuing north, but all at the same time getting dimmer and dimmer, perhaps climbing higher and higher(?), in maybe 3-5 seconds. then it came to a complete stop! seemingly "next to" a star and looked just like a faraway dim star. but then it started moving again toward the north! after a few seconds my eyes lost sight of it, but my exuberant 35 yr. old nephew was able to keep his eyes on it the entire time and said it was now "zig-zagging"! he was completely intrigued and serious, freaking out. then it was completely gone from his view. my 10 year old son, my 35 year old nephew, and my 40 yr. old self (all of whom were straight as arrows at the time) witnessed most of the objects display, while the handful of other people in the driveway only witness it approaching and getting bright for a few seconds before rising in a straight north trajectory. plus, they were too busy enjoying the fireworks and sparklers to take the time out to observe what the 3 of us had. i contacted my local mufon director directly with this as i was hoping for an easy explanation for it. not sure if satellites of any kind maneuver in the same manner? but he thought not...
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Star-like object approached, south to north. flared-up brightly. faded a bit. continued on path up and away. stopped. zig-zagged.

content.detailedDescription:
Myself, my wife, and two of my friends witnessed this event.  we were all in/around my friends backyard pool.  my friend anton first noticed the object  heading towards us from the south.  it was traveling northbound along i-35.  anton spotted the object on the southern horizon, so we got a good look at it as it flew all the way from the southern to the northern horizon in about a minute.  the house is right off of i-35, so it flew right over us.

at first it just looked like a black sphere, as it got closer we saw a constant orange light on the bottom (not blinking).  the object was flying at approximately 2000 ft.  it was going about the same speed as a passenger jet, but was completely silent.  we are in the landing path of the des moines airport and there are frequently jets flying at this altitude, and it is always very loud.  the object appeared to be about the size of a two story house.

the object moved from the southern horizon to the northern horizon and out of sight in about one minute.

afterwards, we all tried to rationalize what it could have been.  my friends dad was in the air force for over 20 years, so we called him and told him what we saw.  he said it sounded like either a secret government aircraft or a ufo.
content.summary: Black sphere with orange light on bottom flying silently at low altitude. (~2000 ft, ~400-500 mph).

content.detailedDescription: On the evening of july 4, 2010 there were 6 of us on my neighbors pontoon boat hoping to watch fireworks from the middle of the lake when my neighbor who was driving shouted "what's that?" as he pointed upward toward the northwest. the object moved from about 45 degrees above the horizon from the nw to se until we lost it at about 45 degrees above the se horizon.  we all looked and were all speechless momentarily as we tried to analyze what we were seeing.  we had seen a satellite earlier that was very typical but this object was many times larger and moving at what appeared to be the same altitude and speed. the size and brilliance, compared to venus which was visible was about the same brilliance but roughly about 5+ times larger.  we all attempted to make guesses at what we had seen but at the speed the object was traveling, none of our guesses seemed to fit what we saw.  it moved too fast for some, was too red for others and was definitely too high for others. to us it was not identifiable.
content.summary: Bright red circular s shape with white band around it.

content.detailedDescription: As i was driving home from a friends house after shooting fireworks, i glanced to the right above the tree line and saw 6-7 bright orange glowing objects in the sky. i figured they were stars. so as i pulled into my apartment complex i looked down the road to my left and saw the objects in a different formation. i turned around , parked, got out and observed these things for approximatly 2 minutes. the moved slowely as if they were intelligent, while huge fireworks were going off beneath them. my mom called and i explained to her what i was observing at the time. once i hung up they started to move out toward the east end of long island, they started to follow each other 1 by 1 in a straight line and as they got further away, they started to dissapear in sequence, 1 at a time, until the last one dissappeared. it was amazing. i was so happy after 35 years i finally had a sighting of my own. i took 2 photos but they were black.
content.summary: 7 bright orange sphere like objects.

content.detailedDescription: A small black circular object seemed to be following just above and slightly behind a plane as the plane was coming into the city from the west. suddenly the object turned bright white for approximately 5 seconds and disappeared from view.
content.summary: Small black circular object following above and slightly behind a plane, turned bright white and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: There have been many sightings by myself, friends, and family around and above my house for the last three years.  some objects appear as stars then jet off at incredible speed and others are reddish orbs. a few times they just swarm overhead with my fiance and i observing.  i had a sighting as a child as well, so i don't know, could be coincidence.  june 15, 2010 around 9pm, outside my house, was a particularly strange sighting i had with my sister and fiance.  we were watching a few ufo glide around a while and then one came up to us and blared us with light for a few seconds and sped off in a blink of an eye. this left me in tears, it scared me.  i saw a daytime ufo two days later over my house, bright white orb. don't know what to make of it all.
content.summary: Multiple orbs, some at fast speeds, one approached and flashed a light at us.

content.detailedDescription:
At 10:25 last night (7/5/10) my wife and i were coming home in our car. 
as we came down our street towards our house in eastern kansas city on eastern border of raytown, my wife said "what's that" as our house came into full view. she stopped the car in middle of street and was pointing at our house.
i was not focused as she was on the sky behind our house and was concerned that she was pointing out something wrong at our house.
i asked her what was she talking about and she said "do you see that" and started backing the car up the street which is slight incline away from our home. 
as we got to the high point of the street - about 4 houses up from our house, i could see what caught her eye. 
above our house and the surrounding tree line were 3 clearly visible objects that were oval shaped and orange/reddish color. 
i could not determine how far away they were or the size but the objects were clearly visible with 2 shapes close together higher and to the left of the third object as we were facing east/northeast.
the shapes looked about like a traffic light from about a half block away except oval in shape and orange/red in color.
we watched these objects which were stationary for couple of minutes.
while watching these 3 oval shapes - a large firework went off in the air to the left of the objects (evening of july 5th and some people still setting off fireworks). 
the sparks from the firework (which seemed to be several blocks from our house) spread in front but to the left of the 2 higher objects which gave imnpression they were much further away.
my wife said when she first saw the shapes - she thought there were 4 but as we sat and watched - i only saw 3.
we drove on to our house and parked car in the garage. 
i went inside and got a pair of binoculars and went to our deck on south/east side of our house. 
i could not see any objects from our deck above the tree line. 
my wife and walked up the street to the spot where we saw the objects from the car, but there was nothing unusual in the sky anywhere to be seen.
when we were looking i could see stars clearly, so the sky was clear or only partly cloudy at this time. 
we did not see the objects move while we were watching them - they were stationary in the sky, but they wee completely gone when we went outside to look for them after parking the car.
content.summary: 3 oval shaped orange/red objects stationary in the air east of our house.
Dull red/orange lights made several passes over or near our home.

content.detailedDescription:
A dim red, non-flickering light appeared over sse fort smith, ar.  i saw it at first when it just appeared out of nowhere.  i was looking into the sky to see fireworks, and at first it stood still for about 10mins.  i didn't watch it the whole time as i figured it was a slow burning firework or a plane light at the top of a radio tower (but briefly wondered why it wasn't going on & off as usual).

after some fireworks happening around the area, i saw it still in the same location still.  then suddenly it started to move toward us.  it also caught the attention of my mother in law.  what was strange to me was that it had no blinking lights at all, no sound for its speed, the light that we did see until it passed us was only on front side of object, and it was very stealthy.  it had to have been moving at around 2-300 miles per hour.

we have an airport and military jets flying in an out.  we are used to seeing planes.  this didn't move like a plane, unless the military was testing.  it was about the size of a f-16, maybe a bit wider and bulker.  we could not determine a color except black (darker than night/dusk sky).  it moved from sse to nnw direction, covering 15-20 in 5mins (3-400mph).

it passed right over us and we didn't even hear the sound of wind friction.  me and my mother-in-law saw it, but it was so silent and dark that two other possible eye witnesses couldn't even see or hear it to try to locate it with their eyes.  but we were pointing at it.  sadly, we did not have video or camera handy.
content.summary: Dim red light appeared over sse fort smith, ar.  no blinking lights at all, no sound, light was only on front side of object. moving roughly about 3-400mph.

content.detailedDescription: We saw an odd light in the sky driving home. it seemed too bright for a star and caught our attention. we both thought we saw it move erratically and wanted to stop and watch it. we pulled into a parking lot so we could better see if it was moving, or a star or maybe plane. we originally both saw the light move but upon watching it, it stayed still like a star. we watched it for a few minutes then it blinked out until we saw nothing. we were about to leave when the light blinked back in as a steady bright yellowish color slightly to the left and moving rapidly. we saw a second light it was moving towards and we assumed one was a plane. when the lights got close, the solid light starting strobing and the strobing light become solid as if they switched light patterns. we unfortunately did not record the light blink out but we did record them moving and changing lighting patterns. we watched both fly off normally as if they were only planes but we both saw it move off a straight line unlike any plane we have seen before. we would really like our video analyzed because when we were watching it, it looked as if one light stopped and waited for the other before following the same flight path.
content.summary: Watched a light blink out and return then move quickly past another flashing light

content.detailedDescription:
While lying in a pickup bed with my two year old son we both witnessed two u.F.O.S.  they were above the mountain in front of my house about 1/4 mile away.  the two objects hovered for at least a minute next to each other then they flew off to the right/south extremely fast leaving the skyline in a second or less.  

my two year old son and i both witnessed the objects are were both very excited to have seen them.  we have only told my parents who were also present but were inside the pickup truck and did not see the objects.
content.summary: Shimmering silver cigar shape with orange/brown band in the middle.
